abstract: A graph of the share of Internet advertising revenue sold by the four big players is a stark map to the current merger mating game: Google is heading higher while AOL, Yahoo and Microsoft sink.
snippet: A graph of the share of Internet advertising revenue sold by the four big players is a stark map to the current merger mating game: Google is heading higher while AOL, Yahoo and Microsoft sink.
lead_paragraph: Sometimes you see a graph that tells the whole story. The one in The Wall Street Journal this morning showing the relative share of online advertising spending of the big players is one of them. (The data, from eMarketer, is below.)

headline.main: The Online Ad Story in a Picture
